title: a
text:
i remember the time you turned around and you smiled
it felt like cupid shot a dart at me
you didn't feel the same,
they missed a shot at you

since then, I'm craving for your love
attention, even sitting next to you
the things that I would do
just to talk to you

how could this possibly be?
they said a boy and a boy
wasn't even meant to be?
im so confused
i don't even know what to say
i think i might've been gay

i love spending time with you
talking about the interests we both do
you're the class president
i was your pretty vice

we've been the closest friends at school
some think we might've been a thing
allegations all denied
expect for one thing

how could this possibly be?
i laid my eyes at the prettiest man i've seen
i'm more confused
to what i'm gonna do or say
i think i might've been gay

do you remember that night
the end of our meaningful friendship
said what i've feel
i read the reply and the events are quite expected

i was rejected
delusions gone wild, untamed and broken
cupid shot a dagger to my heart
the end of a beautiful start

i know what's happening here
i had a crush on a feminine straight guy, i see
love makes you dumb and blind
even makes you delusional

i think i might've been still gay
time to cry those feelings away
ugly cry those feelings away

title: helpline
text:
I can't believe they left me all alone
pills and clothes that scattered on the floor
i love the silence as far as i know
birthday boy's not 19 anymore

responsibilities sounds fun
until the candle burns out easily
managing them sounds good
until you relapsed instantly

i never ask for help
i always rely upon myself
asking someone wouldn't hurt me
unless you don't have someone to talk to

im all alone
crying in my bedroom
the doors are locked
and my teeth are grinding

loneliness is sinking in
the sobs are kicking in
how to ignore it
i wanna know

they expect too much
for someone with a pea brain
im a step away
from falling into insane

they're comparing us like apples to grapes
and now im sitting on the rug
ugly crying til im numb

i keep an archive about my past
in case nostalgia kicks in
and all the interests i keen learning on
but i just start at first and abandon it all

i had a-lot of friends
they genuinely care about me
lack of communication that i have
ghost 'em, silently

they reached out for help
i rejected the offer, funnily
i hate drawing attention to myself
but i love the hypocrisy

im all alone
crying in my bedroom
the doors are locked
and my teeth are grinding

loneliness is sinking in
the sobs are kicking in
desperate to forget it
i wanna know

they expect too much
for someone with a pea brain
im a step away
from falling into insane

stop comparing us like apples to grapes
and now im sitting on the rug
ugly crying til im numb
ugly crying and i sob
ugly crying and i sob
ugly crying til it numb

im all alone
crying in my bedroom
the doors are locked
and my teeth are grinding

loneliness is sinking in
the sobs are kicking in
how to ignore it
i wanna know

doorbells ringing
i bet someone is arriving
maybe it's the parcel
or it's my family

my guess is right
they bought a chocolate cake
and i am standing at the rug
and i wanna stop the sob
i just wanna stop the sob

title: brightest star
text:
why'd you left so suddenly
it's too late to say that i'm sorry
sad goodbyes were never made
we arrived at noon in a shocked state

and salty tears went pouring out of control
husband didn't care about the thing he lost
all he cares about is
the insurance she bought

the vastly skies gained a brightest star
and shot a dagger to our heart
time is frozen as i hold your cold hand while i cry
they gained the brightest star

it's unusual to see
you scrolling facebook in a saddest scene
and while we're crying suddenly
i heard a joke that isn't funny

"you should be happy that she's gone...
...no one's gonna scold you all day long"
kinda wish you're also gone

the vastly skies gained a brightest star
and bought a pain to our hearts
memories went flashing
all the happy things you did to us
while they gained the brightest star

6 days before you went gone
watched you on your death bed all alone
that pretty smile as you said goodbye
i've been crying for a while

ate my tongue, the speech were gone
i haven't said sorry for what i've done

the body's wrapped around a bag
as the cries of confused kids screaming across the room
laid and cast, cut flowers bloom
in a cold quiet somber room

the vastly skies gained a brightest star
our eyes are welling, view was blurry
tears come falling through
while they gained a brightest star

title: substitute
text:
we both know our intentions
i wanted you for my delusions
you wanted a lust consumer

sorry but you're not the man for me
you're just a substitute

title: burn [extra]
text:
watching the candle slowly die
struggling to make it through the night
doing it's best to survive

saw him cry as he fade away
flame's all weak, he just wanna stay
but he's all burned out and tired
as i watch the candle slowly die

title: wrapper
text:
I don't like the sound of that
repeated vents you always spat
found a place to hide
but I was found

tried my best best to suggest
that "you let go
you've been hurt so many times
it doesn't work"

"I can change him for the best"

I am tired of you, friend
if we bond, you always vent
all these things make me
mentally, physically, socially drained

it's time to take care of myself

title: goodbye
text:
as i gaze into your bright brown eyes
while we lay watching the vastly skies
thanks for making me happy
talking to you is enough for me

if you'll ever miss me
look into the sky and find me
i'll be the brightest star
guiding you to succeed from afar

birds chirping, winds breezing
solemn in a place of conflict
flags wave in defeat
war is over, pain is no more

don't worry if things don't work out
life's tough, and that's all about
opportunity knocks on your door in a snap
don't lose hope and never give up
